original: Hägg, Fritz Konrad, redaktör, Jönköping, f. 31/10/84 i Anderstorp, Jön-köp. 1., av bruksäg. Carl Edvard H. 0. Amanda Svensson. G. 09 m. Ruth Wetterhng. Barn: Torsten f. 10, Margit 12, Inga-Lisa 15, Marianne 21. — Elev v. Karlskoga prakt, lärov. 99- 01. Bruksbokhåll. v. Kronofors Glasbruk 01-09, därunder tillika medarb. i Hemmets Vän, Blå Bandet, Smålandsposten m. fl., köpman o. bankman 13-15, omb :man f. Allm. valm:förb. i Kronob. 1. 16-17, samtid, polit. medarb. i Smålandsposten, förlagschef h. H. Halls Boktryck. A-B i Jönköp. sed. 18, därjämte red. av Sv. Posten o. medarb. i Jönköp.-Posten sed. 19, red. av julpubl. Julfrid o. Under Juldagar m. fl. sed. 21, v. verkst. dir. samt styr:ordf. i H. Halls Boktryck. A-B 35. Ordf. i Jönköp. allm. nykterh:-komm. 23-26, lokalavd. av MHF 30-34, 30 Jönköp. 1. nykterh :förb. o. Jönköp. evang. missifören. sed. 34, sekr. i Sv. aliiansmiss. ungd:förb. 28, kd. av styr. f. alliansmiss. 36, v. ordf. 46, suppl. i foIksk:styr. 28, led. av ’stadsfullm. (fp) 31-46, led. .av teredn :utsk. 31-46 o. av lönendn 34-46, ordf. där 38-46. Medk av Pubhkl. sed. 22. Skr.: Knut Wilhelm Almkvist (biogr. 40), Vänner — märke sk vinnor, märkesmän (41), Ett helgons bikt (Mormor på Herrestad 44). Sign.: Prudus, Argus, -g, F. H.
translated: Hägg, Fritz Konrad, editor, Jönköping, born on October 31, 1884 in Anderstorp, Jönköp. 1st district, son of the industrialist Carl Edvard H. and Amanda Svensson. Married in 1909 to Ruth Wetterhng and has four children: Torsten (born 1910), Margit (born 1912), Inga-Lisa (born 1915), and Marianne (born 1921). He was a student at Karlskoga prakt, lärov. from 1899-1901. He worked as a bookkeeper at Kronofors Glasbruk from 1901-1909, during which time he also served as a collaborator in Hemmets Vän, Blå Bandet, Smålandsposten, and others. From 1913-1915 he worked as a merchant and banker, and from 1916-1917 as an agent for the General Voting Association in Kronob. 1. He was also a political collaborator for Smålandsposten. He became the publishing manager for H. Halls Boktryck A-B in Jönköp. starting in 1918, and also served as the editor of Sv. Posten and collaborator of Jönköp.-Posten starting in 1919. He was editor of the holiday publication Julfrid and Under Juldagar, among others, starting in 1921, and became the vice managing director and chairman of the board for H. Halls Boktryck A-B in 1935. He was chairman of the Jönköp. general temperance committee from 1923-1926, and was a member of the local branch of the Swedish Temperance Society from 1930-1934, the Jönköp. 1. temperance association, and the Jönköp. evangelical missionary society from 1934. He was the secretary for the Swedish Alliance Mission Youth Association in 1928, and a member of the board for the Alliance Mission from 1936, serving as deputy chairman in 1946. He was a member of the city council (fp) from 1931-1946, a member of the recruitment committee from 1931-1946, and a member of the salary committee from 1934-1946, serving as chairman from 1938-1946. He was a Fellow of Publicity from 1922 and wrote several books, including Knut Wilhelm Almkvist (biography) in 1940, Friends - the mark of women, marksmen in 1941, and A Saint's Confession (Grandmother on Herrestad 44). Signature: Prudus, Argus, -g, F.H.

structured.name: Fritz Konrad Hägg
structured.description: Fritz Konrad Hägg was a notable figure in the publishing industry in Jönköping. His contributions to Hemmets Vän, Blå Bandet, Smålandsposten, Julfrid, and Under Juldagar are well-renowned. He was also actively involved in local politics, serving as a member of the city council, recruitment committee, and salary committee. Hägg was also a noted author whose works include Knut Wilhelm Almkvist (biography), Friends - the mark of women, marksmen, and A Saint's Confession (Grandmother on Herrestad 44).
